channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
You may think that this is a horrible decision by @TwitterSupport. And you would be right. But according to a Republican law just approved by two Trump-appointed judges, it would be *illegal* to penalize the operator of the cited hateful account. https://t.co/YxZfkXHRH4
It might be legal to ban the use of the twitter handle, but it might not. @AkivaMCohen can correct me, but in a quick read of the Texas law, the question would hinge on whether one’s choice of twitter hand is counts as communication.
Remember: The Texas law is at odds with settle jurisprudence, but this court has repeatedly shown that 1) they’re not bound by traditional jurisprudence and 2) they don’t feel the need to show their work.

@HeerJeet Do you think she might have abandoned conservative polemics for a more wholesome pursuit had her husband, say, run off in 1965 with a time traveling Jackie O lookalike sent from our looming dystopic future to make things right?
@HeerJeet I’m imagining a Commentary that pivoted back to liberalism, offering just enough of a historical nudge to elect Ted Kennedy in 1980….
@rmneiss I’m sure she’ll be equally brave in championing the rights of American journalists after Alito reverts First Amendment jurisprudence.
@bernstein_judah Is the demand for simplistic equalities antisemitic? Or just a denial of the Talmud’s fundamental premise?

@trekonomics Given its geopolitical situation, I don’t think being a tax haven would have helped the regime’s longevity. Not at that stage.
@trekonomics Maybe if France had the foresight to adopt the Swiss approach in 1918….
The First Amendment is whatever Alito decides it is. All of our 20th century rights are now alienable — at least until the court is expanded or contracted. https://t.co/xDOoiGijFj
@questauthority The First Amendment is whatever Alito decides it is. All of our 20th century rights are now alienable — at least until the court is expanded or contracted.
@ASFried @EricKleefeld Do we *know* that he doesn’t write his novels in colored chalk?
@MarkJacob16 Pretty sure he’s playing for Team F.
@onthemainline Omaha!

Good news for Texas Nazis and other antisemites: It is now against state law for Twitter or FB to penalize them for hate speech that falls short of the standard of inciting imminent violence. https://t.co/UA5YdcqzCX
Shoutout to the all the Jewish Republican who helped enable this legal travesty (which upends all legal precedent.)
I do hope that your gentile Republican friends appreciate that you acted out of a purity of belief, and without the need for the sort of unpleasant threats that the Germans required to get their kapos to behave.
@mjs_DC Good thing the Alito Court is committed to upholding all known precedents.
@ZachWeiner I would hate to see how people trying to make space travel unpopular would describe it.
@eddyportnoy And apparently not translated into English until a decade ago!
@TheRaDR כמה יש?

@trekonomics But as good English-speaking Christians, they’re in Heaven, not in Hell like their pagan ancestors.
@trekonomics A very direct line between orthodox Christian theology and genocide.
@NoahShachtman Most publishers aren’t willing to risk the fate of Hong Kong’s Apple. And German firms have a cultural history of getting along with the powers that be.
@jnack Much nicer than I recall their Rochester offices back in the day
A reminder that cops don’t see their job as upholding the rule of law. So what are they upholding? https://t.co/89T2g1alxm
@HeerJeet Wasn’t that when the turn started to happen?
@HeerJeet What year would this be? And might this explain his whole conservative turn?
@dylyricus Damn. I don’t relish getting into a bidding war with Ratso for Joey’s “Larry.”
@ellecannoteven @BryanMinehart @MoiraDonegan @MarieJo45528473 Also for the EPA and libel laws.

Your occasional reminder that we are entering a dystopic theocracy ruled by what they used to call “Cafeteria Catholics.” https://t.co/hLSnwriuGW
Given that Alito et al reject the Vatican’s teachings on the death penalty and unregulated capitalism, no reason to believe they accept its rejection of antisemitism.
“I like that the combined effect of the essays was neither sanitized nostalgia nor ex-orthodox typical fare. They are fresh.” https://t.co/1AFgEMttgg
